meanings.definition: A source of seeds for planting.
meanings.sent1: The farmer purchased high-quality seedstocks for his crops.
meanings.sent2: The garden store had a variety of seedstocks for sale.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel mistook the seedstocks for a snack.
meanings.sent4: Her garden was a treasure trove of diverse seedstocks waiting to bloom.
meanings.sent5: The seedstocks gleamed in the sunlight, promising a bountiful harvest.

meanings.definition: The collection of seeds used for breeding purposes.
meanings.sent1: The scientist carefully cataloged the seedstocks for genetic research.
meanings.sent2: The botanical garden housed a vast collection of rare seedstocks.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to hide the seedstocks for future generations of squirrels.
meanings.sent4: The seedstocks held the potential for creating new plant varieties.
meanings.sent5: In the hands of skilled breeders, seedstocks can lead to remarkable new crops.
